page.title: 15Hampton Church Fete,Evesham.
page.content: At{Hampton Church Fete}the School do {Maypole and country-dancing,}the{May {Queen}is crowned and there are{raffles for prizes, skittles,{games,}tombola, guessing-games, treasure hunt on a map and a lucky dip. The{stalls}are for toys, clothes, sweets and drinks, books, (which has baby books and grown up books), cakes, white elephant stall which sells things like lamps, combs, glasses and odds and ends. They have a flower pot upside down with a hole in and you put in as many marbles as you can in one minute, whoever gets the most in wins. They have{pony {rides, Morris Dancers}and lots of nice things. Sometimes there is a fire engine to look at and old crockery or an old car to smash. The fete is held in the vicarage garden behind the church to raise money for church funds.
